Recommend actions for student wash backs, eliminations and proficiency advancement. Advised curriculum specialists on inadequacies on existing training programs. Researched and developed courseware material for critical units of instruction. Job accomplishments Selected from group of ten to prestigious position as instructor supervisor due to notable leadership ability--position normally held by NCOs more senior in rank; hit ground running, excellent performance. Completely redesigned longest, most in-depth and challenging block of instruction in Intelligence Analysis--assured students benefited form most up-to-date and relevant training in course analytic building blocks. Concrete decision-making skills allowed greater management flexibility during times of austere manning. Extraordinary Instructor! Expertly led classes through course with astonishing class average of over 90%;2 percentage points higher than course average; testament to selfless devotion to profession--Outstanding instructional skill, dedicated, caring attitude reflected on Field Evaluation Questionnaires and end-of-course feedbacks; students and gaining units benefit from highest quality instruction received. Selected to brief Assistant Chief of Staff for Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance on squadron mission; indicative of distinctive communicative and interactive ability
name: Mackle Roberts

title: Command and Control Network Analyst
description: Performed all-source analysis on Command, Control and Communications (C3) nodes and systems to develop C3 files for entry into the U.S. Air Force Command and Control Warfare (C2W) Operational Support System in support of the Air Force mission. Researched, reviewed and extracted country information form command libraries, national and theater-level intelligence agencies and several computerized data retrieval systems. Correlates, verifies and enters data into appropriate data base files. Performed continuous maintenance and quality control of subject data base target countries. Provided critical support to intelligence agencies and commands, outstanding operational contributions paved the way for branch winning Outstanding Branch of the Year.
name: Mackle Roberts
headquarters:
550 D Street West
Suite 1
Randolph AFB,
TX
78150-4527
United States
address: 550 D Street West Suite 1 Randolph AFB, TX 78150-4527 United States

title: Threat Warning Communications Coordinator
description: Managed, evaluated and directed the unit airborne support program. Provided training and technical assistance; coordinated with other units on special interest items to improve overall program. Analyzed and performed quality control of operational information transmitted and received over secure communications. Designed and presented training materials and procedural directives for system operations. Coordinated and synthesized research from other analysts to prepare intelligence products and responses; researched and wrote scheduled and unscheduled reports.
name: Mackle Roberts
